register.name: ESR_EL2
register.description: Holds syndrome information for an exception taken to EL2.

bitField.name: EC
bitField.description: Exception Class. Indicates the reason for the exception that this register holds information about.

bitField.name: IL
bitField.description: Instruction Length for synchronous exceptions.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: TI
bitField.description: Trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: Opc2
bitField.description: The Opc2 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Opc1
bitField.description: The Opc1 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: CRn
bitField.description: The CRn value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rt
bitField.description: The Rt value from the issued instruction, the general-purpose register used for the transfer. The reported value gives the AArch64 view of the register. See .

bitField.name: CRm
bitField.description: The CRm value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: Opc1
bitField.description: The Opc1 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rt2
bitField.description: The Rt2 value from the issued instruction, the second general-purpose register used for the transfer. The reported value gives the AArch64 view of the register. See .

bitField.name: Rt
bitField.description: The Rt value from the issued instruction, the first general-purpose register used for the transfer. The reported value gives the AArch64 view of the register. See .

bitField.name: CRm
bitField.description: The CRm value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: imm8
bitField.description: The immediate value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rn
bitField.description: The Rn value from the issued instruction, the general-purpose register used for the transfer. The reported value gives the AArch64 view of the register. See .

bitField.name: Offset
bitField.description: Indicates whether the offset is added or subtracted:

bitField.name: AM
bitField.description: Addressing mode.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: imm16
bitField.description: The value of the immediate field from the HVC or SVC instruction.

bitField.name: CV
bitField.description: Condition code valid.

bitField.name: COND
bitField.description: The condition code for the trapped instruction. This field is valid only for exceptions taken from AArch32, and only when the value of CV is 1.

bitField.name: CCKNOWNPASS
bitField.description: Indicates whether the instruction might have failed its condition code check.

bitField.name: imm16
bitField.description: The value of the immediate field from the issued SMC instruction.

bitField.name: Op0
bitField.description: The Op0 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Op2
bitField.description: The Op2 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Op1
bitField.description: The Op1 value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: CRn
bitField.description: The CRn value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Rt
bitField.description: The Rt value from the issued instruction, the general-purpose register used for the transfer.

bitField.name: CRm
bitField.description: The CRm value from the issued instruction.

bitField.name: Direction
bitField.description: Indicates the direction of the trapped instruction.

bitField.name: SET
bitField.description: Synchronous Error Type. When the RAS Extension is implemented and IFSC is 010000, describes the state of the PE after taking the Instruction Abort exception.

bitField.name: FnV
bitField.description: FAR not Valid, for a synchronous External abort other than a synchronous External abort on a translation table walk.

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External abort type. This bit can provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of External aborts.

bitField.name: S1PTW
bitField.description: For a stage 2 fault, indicates whether the fault was a stage 2 fault on an access made for a stage 1 translation table walk:

bitField.name: IFSC
bitField.description: Instruction Fault Status Code.

bitField.name: ISV
bitField.description: Instruction syndrome valid. Indicates whether the syndrome information in ISS[23:14] is valid.

bitField.name: SAS
bitField.description: Syndrome Access Size. When ISV is 1, indicates the size of the access attempted by the faulting operation.

bitField.name: SSE
bitField.description: Syndrome Sign Extend. When ISV is 1, for a byte, halfword, or word load operation, indicates whether the data item must be sign extended.

bitField.name: SRT
bitField.description: Syndrome Register transfer. When ISV is 1, the register number of the Rt operand of the faulting instruction. If the exception was taken from an Exception level that is using AArch32 then this is the AArch64 view of the register. See .

bitField.name: SF
bitField.description: Width of the register accessed by the instruction is Sixty-Four.

bitField.name: AR
bitField.description: Acquire/Release.

bitField.name: SET
bitField.description: Synchronous Error Type. When the RAS Extension is implemented and DFSC is 010000, describes the state of the PE after taking the Data Abort exception.

bitField.name: FnV
bitField.description: FAR not Valid, for a synchronous External abort other than a synchronous External abort on a translation table walk.

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External abort type. This bit can provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of External aborts.

bitField.name: CM
bitField.description: Cache maintenance.

bitField.name: S1PTW
bitField.description: For a stage 2 fault, indicates whether the fault was a stage 2 fault on an access made for a stage 1 translation table walk:

bitField.name: WnR
bitField.description: Write not Read. Indicates whether a synchronous abort was caused by an instruction writing to a memory location, or by an instruction reading from a memory location.

bitField.name: DFSC
bitField.description: Data Fault Status Code.

bitField.name: TFV
bitField.description: Trapped Fault Valid bit. Indicates whether the IDF, IXF, UFF, OFF, DZF, and IOF bits hold valid information about trapped floating-point exceptions.

bitField.name: VECITR
bitField.description: For a trapped floating-point exception from an instruction executed in AArch32 state this field is RES1.

bitField.name: IDF
bitField.description: Input Denormal floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: IXF
bitField.description: Inexact floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: UFF
bitField.description: Underflow floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: OFF
bitField.description: Overflow floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: DZF
bitField.description: Divide by Zero floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: IOF
bitField.description: Invalid Operation floating-point exception trapped bit. If the TFV field is 0, this bit is UNKNOWN.

bitField.name: IDS
bitField.description: IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED syndrome.

bitField.name: IESB
bitField.description: Implicit error synchronization event.

bitField.name: EA
bitField.description: External abort type. When the RAS Extension is implemented, this bit can provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of External aborts.

bitField.name: DFSC
bitField.description: Data Fault Status Code.

bitField.name: IFSC
bitField.description: Instruction Fault Status Code. This field is set to 0b100010, to indicate a Debug exception.

bitField.name: ISV
bitField.description: Instruction syndrome valid.

bitField.name: EX
bitField.description: Exclusive operation. If the ISV bit is set to 1, this bit indicates whether a Load-Exclusive instruction was stepped.

bitField.name: IFSC
bitField.description: Instruction Fault Status Code. This field is set to 0b100010, to indicate a Debug exception.

bitField.name: CM
bitField.description: Cache maintenance.

bitField.name: WnR
bitField.description: Write not Read. Indicates whether the abort was caused by an instruction writing to a memory location, or by an instruction reading from a memory location.

bitField.name: DFSC
bitField.description: Data Fault Status Code. This field is set to 0b100010, to indicate a Debug exception.

bitField.name: Comment
bitField.description: Set to the instruction comment field value, zero extended as necessary. For the AArch32 BKPT instructions, the comment field is described as the immediate field.

register.name: HCR_EL2
register.description: Provides configuration controls for virtualization, including defining whether various Non-secure operations are trapped to EL2.

bitField.name: MIOCNCE
bitField.description: Mismatched Inner/Outer Cacheable Non-Coherency Enable, for the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: TEA
bitField.description: Route synchronous External abort exceptions to EL2.

bitField.name: TERR
bitField.description: Trap Error record accesses.

bitField.name: TLOR
bitField.description: Trap LOR registers. Traps accesses to the LORSA_EL1, LOREA_EL1, LORN_EL1, LORC_EL1, and LORID_EL1 registers from Non-secure EL1 to EL2.

bitField.name: E2H
bitField.description: EL2 Host. Enables a configuration where a Host Operating System is running in EL2, and the Host Operating System's applications are running in EL0.

bitField.name: ID
bitField.description: Stage 2 Instruction access cacheability disable. For the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime, when HCR_EL2.VM==1, this control forces all stage 2 translations for instruction accesses to Normal memory to be Non-cacheable.

bitField.name: CD
bitField.description: Stage 2 Data access cacheability disable. For the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime, when HCR_EL2.VM==1, this control forces all stage 2 translations for data accesses and translation table walks to Normal memory to be Non-cacheable.

bitField.name: RW
bitField.description: Execution state control for lower Exception levels:

bitField.name: TRVM
bitField.description: Trap Reads of Virtual Memory controls. Traps Non-secure EL1 reads of the virtual memory control registers to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: HCD
bitField.description: HVC instruction disable. Disables Non-secure state execution of HVC instructions, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TDZ
bitField.description: Trap DC ZVA instructions. Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 execution of DC ZVA instructions to EL2, from AArch64 state only.

bitField.name: TGE
bitField.description: Trap General Exceptions, from Non-secure EL0.

bitField.name: TVM
bitField.description: Trap Virtual Memory controls. Traps Non-secure EL1 writes to the virtual memory control registers to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TTLB
bitField.description: Trap TLB maintenance instructions. Traps Non-secure EL1 execution of TLB maintenance instructions to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TPU
bitField.description: Trap cache maintenance instructions that operate to the Point of Unification. Traps execution of those cache maintenance instructions at Non-secure EL1 or EL0 using AArch64, and at Non-secure EL1 using AArch32, to EL2.

bitField.name: TPCP
bitField.description: Trap data or unified cache maintenance instructions that operate to the Point of Coherency or Persistence. Traps execution of those cache maintenance instructions at Non-secure EL1 or EL0 using AArch64, and at Non-secure EL1 using AArch32, to EL2.

bitField.name: TSW
bitField.description: Trap data or unified cache maintenance instructions that operate by Set/Way. Traps execution of those cache maintenance instructions at Non-secure EL1 using AArch64, and at Non-secure EL1 using AArch32, to EL2.

bitField.name: TACR
bitField.description: Trap Auxiliary Control Registers. Traps Non-secure EL1 accesses to the Auxiliary Control Registers to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TIDCP
bitField.description: Trap IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED functionality. Traps Non-secure EL1 accesses to the encodings reserved for IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED functionality to EL2.

bitField.name: TSC
bitField.description: Trap SMC instructions. Traps Non-secure EL1 execution of SMC instructions to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TID3
bitField.description: Trap ID group 3.

bitField.name: TID2
bitField.description: Trap ID group 2.

bitField.name: TID1
bitField.description: Trap ID group 1.

bitField.name: TID0
bitField.description: Trap ID group 0.

bitField.name: TWE
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 execution of WFE instructions to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: TWI
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 execution of WFI instructions to EL2, from both Execution states.

bitField.name: DC
bitField.description: This field is permitted to be cached in a TLB.

bitField.name: BSU
bitField.description: Barrier Shareability upgrade.

bitField.name: FB
bitField.description: Force broadcast.

bitField.name: VSE
bitField.description: Virtual SError interrupt.

bitField.name: VI
bitField.description: Virtual IRQ Interrupt.

bitField.name: VF
bitField.description: Virtual FIQ Interrupt.

bitField.name: AMO
bitField.description: Physical SError interrupt routing.

bitField.name: IMO
bitField.description: Physical IRQ Routing.

bitField.name: FMO
bitField.description: Physical FIQ Routing.

bitField.name: PTW
bitField.description: Protected Table Walk. In the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime, a translation table access made as part of a stage 1 translation table walk is subject to a stage 2 translation. The combining of the memory type attributes from the two stages of translation means the access might be made to a type of Device memory.

bitField.name: SWIO
bitField.description: Set/Way Invalidation Override.

bitField.name: VM
bitField.description: Virtualization enable. Enables stage 2 address translation for the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime.

register.name: TCR_EL2
register.description: The control register for stage 1 of the EL2, or EL2&0, translation regime...

bitField.name: TG0
bitField.description: Granule size for the TTBR0_EL2.

bitField.name: SH0
bitField.description: Shareability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using TTBR0_EL2.

bitField.name: ORGN0
bitField.description: Outer cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using TTBR0_EL2.

bitField.name: IRGN0
bitField.description: Inner cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using TTBR0_EL2.

bitField.name: T0SZ
bitField.description: The size offset of the memory region addressed by TTBR0_EL2. The region size is 2^(64-T0SZ) bytes.

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure EL1 accesses to CPACR_EL1 and CPACR are trapped to EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_EL1_accesses_to_CPACR_EL1_and_CPACR_are_trapped_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Unknown reason.
tcf:enumItem.name: Unknown_reason

tcf:enumItem.name: Trapped_WFI_or_WFE_instruction_execution

tcf:enumItem.name: Illegal_Execution_state

tcf:enumItem.name: SVC_instruction_execution_in_AArch32_state

tcf:enumItem.description: HVC instruction execution in AArch32 state, when HVC is not disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: HVC_instruction_execution_in_AArch32_state_when_HVC_is_not_disabled

tcf:enumItem.name: SMC_instruction_execution_in_AArch32_state_when_SMC_is_not_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: SVC instruction execution in AArch64 state.

tcf:enumItem.name: HVC_instruction_execution_in_AArch64_state_when_HVC_is_not_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: SMC instruction execution in AArch64 state, when SMC is not disabled...
tcf:enumItem.name: SMC_instruction_execution_in_AArch64_state_when_SMC_is_not_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Trapped MSR, MRS or System instruction execution in AArch64 state, that is not reported using EC 0b000000, 0b000001 or 0b000111...
tcf:enumItem.name: Trapped_MSR_MRS_or_System_instruction_execution_in_AArch64_state_that_is_not_reported_using_EC_0b000000_0b000001_or_0b000111

tcf:enumItem.description: Access to SVE functionality trapped as a result of CPACR_EL1.ZEN, CPTR_EL2.ZEN, CPTR_EL2.TZ, or CPTR_EL3.EZ, that is not reported using EC 0b000000...
tcf:enumItem.name: Access_to_SVE_functionality_trapped_as_a_result_of_CPACR_EL1

tcf:enumItem.description: One or more floating-point exceptions occurred during an operation performed while executing the reported instruction. The IDF, IXF, UFF, OFF, DZF, and IOF bits indicate trapped floating-point exceptions that occurred. For more information see .
tcf:enumItem.name: One_or_more_floating_point_exceptions_occurred_during_an_operation_performed_while_executing_the_reported_instruction

tcf:enumItem.description: Input denormal floating-point exception has not occurred.
tcf:enumItem.name: Input_denormal_floating_point_exception_has_not_occurred

tcf:enumItem.name: Input_denormal_floating_point_exception_occurred_during_execution_of_the_reported_instruction

tcf:enumItem.name: Inexact_floating_point_exception_has_not_occurred

tcf:enumItem.name: Inexact_floating_point_exception_occurred_during_execution_of_the_reported_instruction

tcf:enumItem.name: Invalid_Operation_floating_point_exception_occurred_during_execution_of_the_reported_instruction

tcf:enumItem.description: Bits[23:0] of the ISS field are defined in this description.
tcf:enumItem.name: Bits_23_0_of_the_ISS_field_are_defined_in_this_description

tcf:enumItem.name: The_SError_interrupt_was_synchronized_by_the_implicit_error_synchronization_event_and_taken_immediately

tcf:enumItem.description: An instruction other than a Load-Exclusive instruction was stepped.
tcf:enumItem.name: An_instruction_other_than_a_Load_Exclusive_instruction_was_stepped

tcf:enumItem.description: A Load-Exclusive instruction was stepped.
tcf:enumItem.name: A_Load_Exclusive_instruction_was_stepped

tcf:enumItem.description: For the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime, for permitted accesses to a memory location that use a common definition of the Shareability and Cacheability of the location, there must be no loss of coherency if the Inner Cacheability attribute for those accesses differs from the Outer Cacheability attribute.

For the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime, for permitted accesses to a memory location that use a common definition of the Shareability and Cacheability of the location, there might be a loss of coherency if the Inner Cacheability attribute for those accesses differs from the Outer Cacheability attribute.
Does not route synchronous External abort exceptions from Non-secure EL0 and EL1 to EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: Does_not_route_synchronous_External_abort_exceptions_from_Non_secure_EL0_and_EL1_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Route synchronous External abort exceptions from Non-secure EL0 and EL1 to EL2, if not routed to EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: Route_synchronous_External_abort_exceptions_from_Non_secure_EL0_and_EL1_to_EL2_if_not_routed_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Does not trap accesses to error record registers from Non-secure EL1 to EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: Does_not_trap_accesses_to_error_record_registers_from_Non_secure_EL1_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Accesses to the ER* registers from Non-secure EL1 generate a Trap exception to EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: Accesses_to_the_ER_registers_from_Non_secure_EL1_generate_a_Trap_exception_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_does_not_cause_any_instructions_to_be_trapped

tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_EL1_accesses_to_the_LOR_registers_are_trapped_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: EL2 is running a hypervisor.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL2_is_running_a_hypervisor

tcf:enumItem.description: EL2 is running a Host Operating System.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL2_is_running_a_Host_Operating_System

tcf:enumItem.description: This control has no effect on stage 2 of the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_has_no_effect_on_stage_2_of_the_Non_secure_EL1_0_translation_regime

tcf:enumItem.description: For the Non-secure EL1&0 translation regime, forces all stage 2 translations for instruction accesses to Normal memory to be Non-cacheable.

tcf:enumItem.name: For_the_Non_secure_EL1_0_translation_regime_forces_all_stage_2_translations_for_data_accesses_and_translation_table_walks_to_Normal_memory_to_be_Non_cacheable

tcf:enumItem.name: A_virtual_SError_interrupt_is_pending_because_of_this_mechanism

tcf:enumItem.description: This mechanism is not making a virtual IRQ pending.

tcf:enumItem.description: This mechanism is not making a virtual FIQ pending.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_mechanism_is_not_making_a_virtual_FIQ_pending

tcf:enumItem.description: A virtual FIQ is pending because of this mechanism.
tcf:enumItem.name: A_virtual_FIQ_is_pending_because_of_this_mechanism

tcf:enumItem.description: When executing at Non-secure Exception levels below EL2, physical SError interrupts are not taken to EL2...
tcf:enumItem.name: When_executing_at_Non_secure_Exception_levels_below_EL2_physical_SError_interrupts_are_not_taken_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.name: When_executing_at_any_Exception_level_in_Non_secure_state

tcf:enumItem.description: The translation table walk occurs as if it is to Normal Non-cacheable memory. This means it can be made speculatively.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_translation_table_walk_occurs_as_if_it_is_to_Normal_Non_cacheable_memory

tcf:enumItem.description: The memory access generates a stage 2 Permission fault.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_memory_access_generates_a_stage_2_Permission_fault

tcf:enumItem.description: This control has no effect on the operation of data cache invalidate by set/way instructions.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_control_has_no_effect_on_the_operation_of_data_cache_invalidate_by_set_way_instructions

tcf:enumItem.description: Data cache invalidate by set/way instructions perform a data cache clean and invalidate by set/way.
tcf:enumItem.name: Data_cache_invalidate_by_set_way_instructions_perform_a_data_cache_clean_and_invalidate_by_set_way

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure EL1&0 stage 2 address translation disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_EL1_0_stage_2_address_translation_disabled

tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_EL1_0_stage_2_address_translation_enabled
